detail_description: When in Chonburi, a visit to Sriracha Tiger Zoo is a must, especially if you're traveling with kids. Situated in Racha District along the shoreline of Chonburi, this zoo boasts an impressive population of around 200 tigers and approximately 10,000 crocodiles, making it one of the largest collections of these animals. Visitors can enjoy entertaining shows featuring intelligent animals and benefit from ample parking space.
name: SriRacha Tiger Zoo
address: 528, หนองขาม Si Racha District, Chon Buri 20230, Thailand

excerpt: This 500-acre attraction offers a variety of themed gardens, elephant shows & rides, plus an eatery.
detail_description: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden is a sprawling 500-acre attraction that offers a diverse range of experiences. In addition to its themed gardens showcasing Thai culture, it features elephant shows and rides, as well as a variety of dining options. The garden is one of the largest botanical gardens in Southeast Asia and boasts an array of plant species, including orchids, bonsai trees, and cacti. Visitors can also enjoy performances, activities, and even explore a small zoo within the expansive grounds.
name: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden
address: 34, Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Built entirely with hand-hewn wood carvings, this still unfinished 20-story complex offers tours.
detail_description: Sanctuary of Truth is a 20-story complex made entirely of hand-hewn wood carvings, still under construction but open for tours. Similar to the Tibetan sand mandala art, this massive teak structure is a blend of architecture and philosophy, depicting lessons from various religions emphasizing respect for elders, choosing company wisely, and treating others well. It serves as a remarkable place for reflection on higher ideals and the impermanence of life.
name: Sanctuary of Truth
address: 206, 2 Pattaya-Na Kluea Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Lounge chairs line this bustling beach with water sports like parasailing & restaurants nearby.
detail_description: Pattaya Beach is a bustling and popular destination with a 4 km crescent-shaped coast divided into three zones: north, center, and south. Visitors can enjoy lounging on beach chairs, engaging in water sports like parasailing, or exploring the nearby restaurants and shops.
name: Pattaya Beach
address: Chon Buri, Thailand

excerpt:
Bang Saen Beach simply known as Bang Saen is in Tambon Saen Suk, Mueang Chonburi district, Chonburi province, eastern Thailand. It is about 108 km east of Bangkok. It is a popular beach due to its proximity to Bangkok and Pattaya.
The beach is about 2.5 km long, maintained by Thesaban Mueang Saen Suk. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Bang Saen Ville, located in Tambon Saen Suk, Mueang Chonburi district, Chonburi province, eastern Thailand, is a popular beach destination known for its 2.5 km stretch of well-maintained coastline. The area is renowned for its proximity to Bangkok and Pattaya, making it a convenient choice for visitors. One of the main draws of Bang Saen Ville is its abundance of fresh seafood served in local restaurants along the seaside district.
name: Bang Saen Ville
address: Huai Kapi, Chon Buri District, Chon Buri 20130, Thailand

excerpt: Attraction housing miniature models of renowned Thai & international monuments, with on-site cafe.
detail_description: Mini Siam is a captivating miniature park that showcases scaled-down replicas of famous landmarks and historical buildings from Thailand's rich history as well as iconic sites from around the world. Visitors can marvel at miniatures of renowned cultural sites such as Wat Arun, Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall, and Wat Phra Kaew, alongside European landmarks like the Tower Bridge and the Eiffel Tower. The park offers a unique opportunity to feel like a giant while exploring these intricate models.
name: Mini Siam
address: 387 Sukhumvit Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Indoor aquarium showcasing Thailand's marine life, with a 100-meter underwater tunnel & shark dives.
detail_description: Underwater World Pattaya is the city's sole aquarium, offering a diverse showcase of Thailand's marine life. Despite its smaller size compared to other aquariums, it boasts an impressive array of sea creatures from various underwater environments. Visitors can engage in unique experiences such as feeding koi fish from bottles, encountering sharks and rays up close, and exploring Thailand's largest collection of jellyfish.
name: Underwater World Pattaya
address: 22, 22 หมู่ 11 Sukhumvit Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Tree-lined 6-km. stretch of sand offering loungers, bars, restaurants & water sports.
detail_description: Jomtien Beach, also known as Chom Thian, is a serene 6-km stretch of sand lined with trees and offering various amenities such as loungers, bars, restaurants, and water sports. The beach provides uninterrupted views of Pattaya Bay and the surrounding area. Visitors can explore the hilltop viewpoint which offers panoramic views of Pattaya and Jomtien at any time of the day.
name: Jomtien Beach
address: Chon Buri, Thailand

excerpt: Safari park with big African mammals, tigers & apes, plus hands-on feedings & shows.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque province of Chonburi, Khao Kheow Open Zoo is a must-visit destination for animal lovers and adventure seekers alike. This remarkable safari park showcases an impressive array of over 300 species, including majestic African mammals, tigers, and playful apes. What sets this zoo apart is its open-concept design that allows visitors to interact closely with the animals—feeding them and even enjoying unique experiences like a penguin parade or elephant rides.
name: Khao Kheow Open Zoo
address: หมู่ที่ 7, 235, Bang Phra, Si Racha District, Chon Buri 20110, Thailand

excerpt: Movie-themed amusement park featuring waterslides, pools & a variety of dining options.
detail_description: Step into the world of your favorite Columbia Pictures movies at Columbia Pictures Aquaverse, a movie-themed amusement park that offers a unique blend of water-based attractions and iconic film experiences. Located just 20 minutes from a luxury hotel in Pattaya, this immersive water park features over 150 attractions inspired by blockbuster hits like Jumanji, Ghostbusters, and Hotel Transylvania.
name: Columbia Pictures Aquaverse
address: 888 หมู่ 8 Sukhumvit Rd, Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Family-friendly park with high-speed water slides, wave pools, kiddie areas & a floating market.
detail_description: Ramayana Water Park is a top destination for families, offering an array of thrilling water slides, wave pools, and attractions suitable for all ages. Located just 10 minutes from Pattaya beach in the picturesque Silver Lake area, this expansive park boasts 21 exhilarating rides, including unique experiences not found elsewhere in Asia. Visitors can enjoy everything from high-speed slides to relaxing in private cabanas while savoring the diverse food offerings.
name: Ramayana Water Park
address: 9 หมู่ที่ 7 Ban Yen Rd, Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Visitors can soar over the treetops at this zip-line attraction with an educational aspect.
detail_description: Flight of the Gibbon in Chonburi offers an exhilarating zip-line adventure through the treetops, providing an educational and thrilling experience for visitors. The attraction also features an open zoo where families can interact with various animals like monkeys, koalas, lions, and more. For those seeking a more adventurous experience, there are 23 zip-line stations and opportunities to abseil down as well. Visitors can book the whole experience online, including hotel pick-up and drop-off services.
name: Flight of the Gibbon - Chonburi
address: Bang Phra, Si Racha District, Chon Buri 20110, Thailand

excerpt: Hilltop observation point known for monkeys & popular for panoramic sea & sunset views.
detail_description: Khao Sam Muk Viewpoint in Chonburi, Thailand is a popular hilltop observation point known for its panoramic sea and sunset views. Visitors can reach the viewpoint by taking a short hike or driving up the road to the top. The 1.6-km loop trail near Mueang Chon Buri is an easy route, perfect for hiking, road biking, and scenic driving. It offers solitude during quieter times of the day and welcomes leashed dogs.
name: Khao Sam Muk Viewpoint
address: 8W73+2J2, Saen Suk, Chon Buri District, Chon Buri 20130, Thailand

detail_description: Tiffany's Show Pattaya is a grand cabaret performance that showcases dazzling costumes, energetic music, and meticulously choreographed routines. The show features talented performers who are ladyboys, known for their flawless acts and extravagant stage presence. With rapid scene changes and state-of-the-art stage designs, the show offers a larger-than-life experience with glittering outfits adorned with sequins, rhinestones, and feathers.
name: Tiffany's Show Pattaya
address: 464 หมู่ที่ 9, Pattaya Sai Song Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Prominent hill with panoramic views of the bay, considered a local symbol of protection.
detail_description: Khao Sam Muk is a stunning hill that offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Gulf of Thailand, making it a must-visit for anyone exploring Chonburi. This iconic site is not only a natural wonder but also steeped in cultural significance, featuring the revered Chinese shrine dedicated to Mazu, believed to protect local fishermen. As you wander through this picturesque area, you'll encounter playful wild monkeys and can explore the unique Cactus Garden perched atop the hill.
name: Khao Sam Muk
address: Saen Suk, Chon Buri District, Chon Buri 20130, Thailand

excerpt: Whimsical farm featuring sheep, birds, animal shows, games & colorful playscapes for children.
detail_description: Family Park Pattaya, established in 2013, is the largest sheep farm in Thailand and offers a unique opportunity for visitors to interact with adorable sheep. The farm features various activities such as bottle-feeding milk to the animals, trampoline fun, and pony rides for children.
name: Family Park Pattaya
address: XXFG+6GR, 73, Nong Pla Lai, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Sandy beaches, water sports & seafood restaurants, popular with day trippers from Pattaya.
detail_description: Koh Larn, also known as Coral Island, is a popular destination for day trippers from Pattaya. Just a short speedboat ride away from the mainland, this beautiful island offers pristine white sand beaches and crystal-clear blue waters. Visitors can enjoy various water activities such as jet skiing, scuba diving, and windsurfing. The island is also home to luxurious resorts and vibrant marine life with colorful corals for snorkeling or diving.
name: The Coral Islands, Koh Larn, Pattaya
address: Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: High-energy promenade abuzz nightly with go-go bars, souvenir shops, restaurants & discos.
detail_description: Walking Street in Pattaya, Thailand is a vibrant and lively promenade that comes alive at night. Spanning a full kilometer from Beach Road to Bali Hai Plaza, it is lined with an array of entertainment options including go-go bars, nightclubs, beer bars, and restaurants. The surrounding side streets offer even more choices for nightlife enthusiasts. From karaoke bars to sports bars and discotheques, there's something for everyone here.
name: Walking St
address: Muang Pattaya, Amphoe Bang Lamung, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Hilltop religious site with a famed colossal Buddha statue & a staircase flanked by huge dragons.
detail_description: Wat Phra Yai, also known as Big Buddha Hill, is a hilltop religious site located in south Pattaya. It features an 18-meter tall Buddha statue and a staircase flanked by huge dragons. The temple complex includes other popular temples like Wat Yansangwararam Woramahawihan, Wat Khao Phra Bat Temple, and Wat Pa Pradu. Visitors can enjoy the serene ambiance and panoramic views of Pattaya and its coastline from this elevated location.
name: Wat Phra Yai
address: 384 Regent Soi 2, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Pattaya is a city on Thailand’s eastern Gulf coast known for its beaches. A quiet fishing village as recently as the 1960s, it’s now lined with resort hotels, high-rise condos, shopping malls, cabaret bars and 24-hour clubs. Nearby, hillside Wat Phra Yai Temple features an 18m-tall golden Buddha. The area also features several designer golf courses, some with views of Pattaya Bay.
detail_description: Pattaya City, located along Thailand's eastern Gulf coast, has transformed from a serene fishing village in the 1960s into a vibrant hub of activity. Today, it boasts stunning beaches and is dotted with luxurious resorts, high-rise condominiums, bustling shopping malls, lively cabaret bars, and clubs that never sleep. A must-visit landmark is the Wat Phra Yai Temple which features an impressive 18-meter golden Buddha statue perched on a hillside.
name: Pattaya City
address: Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand
